title: Boxlet Storage
description: Developed an online marketplace that targeted students with lease terms that prevent subleases to rent space in their apartments for storage. Connected hosts with students needing affordable local summer storage. Acquired 40 customers in first 3 weeks of company life. Created MVP of technical product. Designed scalable back-end. Developed Go-to-market strategy and created pricing models.
business_skills: Promotional Marketing, Customer Discovery, Design, Ad Campaigns
technical_skills: HTML, CSS, JS, Node.JS, Google APIs, FB APIs, Stripe API, Heroku, Firebase

title: MDB
description: Designed, developed, and deployed an iOS app connecting influencers to eventgoers under a $50,000 contract for high-growth startup. Led team of 6 developers to deliver over 120 app features by enforcing AGILE development sprints, increasing sprint velocity by 70% Developed & taught 80-hour iOS development and user research curriculum to 17 students driving 95% freshman job placement rate

title: Sage Intacct
description: A Saas company providing cloud-based financial accounting software. Created integration between SEM machine learning tool and marketing automation platform. Created lead qualification AI. Created analytics and predictive intelligence tool for telemarkters. Performed multiple data dives across funnel and resolved pipeline inefficiences.
business_skills: Data analysis, Marketo, Adwords, Google Analytics, Microsoft Excel, Salesforce, Presentation Skills
technical_skills: HTML, CSS, DJango, Python, R, Heroku, Batch, FTP libraries, Assorted APIs, Node.JS, Express.JS, Chart.JS, CryptoJS, VBA

title: Ishan4Senate
description: Senate Campaign running on three platforms: Improving transportation on campus, increasing accessibilty of resources for start-ups, and creating more opportunities for professional development. Led much of the creative process automated email farming to amass over 400 votes.
technical_skills: HTML, CSS, JS, Responsive Web Design, Bash Scripting, System Macros, Final Cut Pro

title: Illumix
description: The Looking Glass is an augmented reality gaming studio bringing fandom worlds to life by partnering with the relevant IP owners. Increased recruiting awareness by designing 15+ design assets for a recruiting fair and developed additional assets for the landing page. Finalized company logo amongst 18 different propositions.

title: Market Games
description: Berkeley-Haas start-up providing business simulation games for higher education. Tested product in business simulations, as well as performed research on higher education institutions through speaking with department heads in order to better design and tailor web-based content.
business_skills: Content Marketing, Marketing Collateral Design, Market Research, Product Testing, Business Finances, Business Operations

title: Lightspeed
description: One of the world’s leading VC firms, annually inviting college startups to become fellows and grow their businesses. Awarded $65K grant for Memory Labs. Launched 3 marketing initiatives built on on discussions with partners and assignments that taught me more about customer discovery, financing, marketing, and pitching.
business_skills: Customer Discovery, Promotional Marketing & Design, Adwords, Analytics, Customer Assurance, Decking
technical_skills: HTML, CSS, JS, Voice APIs, Hardware Configuration

title: Memory Labs
description: Berkeley-based startup developing a voice-based AI assistant for the Alzheimer’s & Dementia community. Increased market segment awareness through outreach and marketing strategy. Improved product-market fit using data from customer conversations.
business_skills: Customer Discovery, Promotional Marketing & Design, Adwords, Analytics, Customer Assurance, Decking
technical_skills: HTML, CSS, JS, Voice APIs, Hardware Configuration

title: Intero
description: As a real estate agent with Intero, I helped buyers and sellers with their real estate needs. Performing analyses and creating reports, I was able to consistently and accurately forecast home selling prices. Over the course of one summer, I was able to put together a strong team across escrow, lending, and insurance agents to cut closing periods by 25% over industry average.
technical_skills: Adobe Photoshop, Property Web Design, Offer Packet Design

title: AGF
description: As a Vote Everywhere Ambassador of the Andrew Goodman Foundation, I worked to host California Secretary of State Alex Padilla, to speak on the importance of voter registration to over 400 students. I also arranged for ballot boxes at Cal and obtained NSLVE enrollment for the school. Registered 200+ students for the 2016 election.

title: Azaad
description: UC Berkeley Azaad is a nationally-ranked collegiate fusion dance team. While a large part of my time with this organization goes towards dancing, I also developed a leadership skills as a captain, learning to lead and connect efforts across departments. I also managed and fundraised a budget of $17K, managed prop logistics, and led digital recruiting efforts.
technical_skills: Final Cut Pro, Motion, Excel, Adobe Audition

title: Free Ventures
description: Berkeley-based accelerator program located at The House providing students with the resources to grow their ideas and innovate. I attended weekly networking sessions with professionals in the technology and medical sectors for industry perspective as a part of Memory Labs. Fine-tuned the craft of creating pitch decks with program coordinators with over 40 hours of decking, and ended up pitching to VC firms, including Grelock Partners, Sequoia, and KPCB.

title: ASUC Offices
description: I was a part of both Senator Chris Yamas' office, as well as the Financial Wellness Commission. During my time, I worked on an ASUC transfer student amendment which would increase their representation in student government. Additionally, I wrote, lobbied, and got a bill passed that would require that incoming students complete a basic financial literacy module.

title: Peer Court
description: Justice program with County’s Probation Department working to process dispositional hearings for minors guilty of misdemeanors. Helped 15+ minors restore themselves and community. Met with offenders/victims to obtain mitigatory/exacerbating circumstances not in the JCR. Determined interventions best suited to stop crime pattern development through restorative justice. Drafted and conducted opening/closing statements, direct/cross exams before a jury of peers and a Superior Court Judge.
